item.description:
Index of sub-dictionary mechanics.

item.title: Stiffness
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Linear stiffness between two points in a 1D space. In Laplace domain with \(s\in\mathbb C\):

\begin{equation*} f(s) = \frac{K\,e(s)}{s}. \end{equation*}

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Saturating spring (Springsat)
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Saturating spring from [1] (chap 7) with state \(q\in [-q_{sat}, q_{sat}]\) and parameters described below. The energy is

\begin{equation*} H(q) = K_0 \, \left( \frac{q^2}{2} + K_{sat} H_{sat}(q)\right), \end{equation*}

with

\begin{equation*} H_{sat}(q) = - \frac{8 q_{sat}}{\pi \left(4-\pi\right)} \, \left(\frac{\pi^{2} q^{2}}{8q_{sat}^{2}} + \log{\left (\cos{\left (\frac{\pi q}{2 q_{sat}} \right)} \right)}\right). \end{equation*}

The resulting force is:

\begin{equation*} f(q)= \frac{d\,H(q)}{d q} = K_{0} \left(q + K_{sat} \frac{d\,H_{sat}(q)}{d q}\right), \end{equation*}

with

\begin{equation*} \frac{d\,H_{sat}(q)}{d q}= \frac{4}{4- \pi} \left(\tan{\left (\frac{\pi q}{2 q_{sat}} \right )} - \frac{\pi q}{2q_{sat}} \right). \end{equation*}

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Cubic spring (Springcubic)
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Cubic spring with state \(q\in \mathbb R\) and parameters described below. The energy is

\begin{equation*} H(q) = \frac{F_1\,q^2}{2\,q_{ref}} + \frac{F_3\,q^4}{4q_{ref}^3}. \end{equation*}

The resulting force is:

\begin{equation*} f(q)= \frac{d \, H(q)}{d q} = F_1 \,\frac{q}{q_{ref}} + F_3 \, \frac{q^3}{q_{ref}^3}. \end{equation*}

so that \(f(q_{ref}) = F1+F3\).

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Mechanical Source (Source)
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Source of force or velocity imposed between two points.

item.title: Mass
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Mass moving in 1D space. In Laplace domain with \(s\in\mathbb C\):

\begin{equation*} e(s) = \frac{f(s)}{M\,s}. \end{equation*}

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Felt material (Felt)
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Nonlinear felt material used in piano-hammer. The model is that found in [1] eq. (11). It includes a nonlinear restoring force and a nonlinear damper as follows:

\begin{equation*} f_{total}\left(c, \dot c\right) = f_{elastic}(c) + f_{damper}\left(c, \dot c\right), \end{equation*}

with

\begin{equation*} f_{elastic}(c) = F \,c ^B, \end{equation*}

and

\begin{equation*} f_{damper}\left(c, \dot c\right) = \frac{A \, L}{B} c^{B-1} \,\dot c, \end{equation*}

where \(c = \frac{\max (q, 0)}{L}\) is the crush of the hammer with contraction \(q\in\mathbb R\).

Read more… (1 min remaining to read)

item.title: Linear Damper (Damper)
item.dc:creator: PyPHS project
item.description:
Linear mechanical damping (i.e. opposing force proportional to the velocity). In Laplace domain with \(s\in\mathbb C\):

\begin{equation*} f(s) = A \, e(s). \end{equation*}
